oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Rain Sorcerer, ||kunn. In the Katkop dialect, by Dia!kwain (L V.-22. 5743-5754). ||kunn says that the people have spoken harshly to him, as if he really owned the rain. They scold him when it does not fall, but forget that they asked him for it when the rain does fall. 1) This story is found in Book V-22.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The rainmaker ||kunn
